headline: Goldman Sachs Unveils ‚ÄòExtraordinarily Cheap‚Äô Stock Group That‚Äôs Now Showing Signs of Life
summary: Goldman Sachs managing director Greg Tuorto is saying that an under-the-radar equity group is now flashing signs of bullish momentum. In a new CNBC interview, Tuorto says the small-cap stocks possess more upside potential amid attractive valuations and the possibility of various catalysts spurring more appreciation. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre starting to see some signs of life in the small cap market. As you mentioned, it‚Äôs been a good month to date for small versus large. We think that‚Äôs a reflection of a number of things. There are some catalysts in the stocks, but they‚Äôre extraordinarily cheap, and the underlying economic environment is quite good. And I think, as we set our sights on the Fed cutting rates in the back half of the year, you have a couple of tailwinds.‚Äù With consumer activity serving as the leading driver for the uptrend in the stock market, the Goldman Sachs executive names a few sectors that are also likely to get a boost. ‚ÄúI think you have to start to see a hand-off to some other sectors. We‚Äôre pretty encouraged about tech, software, semiconductors would be an area that, I think, could take a nice hand-off. But also aerospace and defense have done quite well. And we expect to see some more [Initial Public Offering] IPO activity in that space, because space is quite active. headline: Bitcoin Miner Mawson Fires CEO, Files Fraud Lawsuit ‚Äì What‚Äôs Going On?
summary: Key Takeaways: Mewawalla‚Äôs dismissal follows broader scrutiny of executive pay practices in crypto infrastructure firms. The lawsuit marks Mawson‚Äôs second major legal dispute in 2025, both linked to operational asset control. Canaan‚Äôs ongoing expansion at Mawson‚Äôs site continues despite parallel litigation. Bitcoin miner Mawson Infrastructure has fired its CEO and President, Rahul Mewawalla, for cause, accusing him of breaching fiduciary duties and engaging in fraud. According to TheMinerMag , the board placed Mewawalla on administrative leave shortly after notifying him of potential termination on May 30. By July 8, his removal became official. Bitcoin Miner Mawson Sues Ex-CEO Mawson has also filed a lawsuit in Delaware‚Äôs Court of Chancery seeking damages and the return of compensation awarded earlier this year. In February, the board approved a $2.5 million cash bonus, 1.2 million restricted stock units, and a salary increase to $1.2 million for Mewawalla. The company cited ‚Äúhigh-performing‚Äù leadership in that announcement. In a July 17 letter to Mawson‚Äôs board, Mewawalla disputed the accusations, stating he ‚Äúrespectfully and vigorously‚Äù disagreed with the company‚Äôs account. He referred to the board‚Äôs own prior filings, which credited him with 36% revenue growth and improved gross margins during his tenure. The company named General Counsel Kaliste Saloom as interim CEO. Mewawalla‚Äôs board seat has also been revoked. The lawsuit filed against Mewawalla has not yet been made public, and the company has not released further details about the specific misconduct alleged. Mewawalla has not publicly responded beyond his letter to the board. AI firms are now using excess data center power to mine Bitcoin, helping to stabilize grids and improve energy efficiency. #Bitcoin #Mining #AI #RenewableEnergy https://t.co/8ZnTfdRETq ‚Äî Cryptonews.com (@cryptonews) July 11, 2025 Second Legal Dispute in 2025 The complaint marks the second major legal dispute involving Mawson this year. In March, NYDIG‚Äôs parent company, Stone Ridge, and its mining subsidiary, Consensus Colocation, sued Mawson for allegedly taking control of 20,000 ASIC miners worth $30 million hosted at a facility in Midland, Pennsylvania. Mawson has since signed a new agreement with Canaan to host over 17,000 new units at the same Midland site. The three-year deal includes approximately 64 megawatts of capacity and supports Canaan‚Äôs 4.7 EH/s hashrate expansion in North America. The leadership change comes as the mining firm seeks to stabilize operations and attract partners in a competitive colocation market. Pending legal outcomes may influence future contractual relationships and financing terms. The incident reveals ongoing governance challenges in the crypto mining sector, where executive pay and accountability remain under heightened scrutiny. Boards may face increased pressure to justify incentive structures and enforce oversight mechanisms in such a volatile environment. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) What role does fiduciary duty play in crypto-native firms with hybrid operational models? In companies operating both infrastructure and financial services, fiduciary obligations may cover both traditional shareholders and tokenholders, adding complexity to governance enforcement and dispute resolution. How might this affect Mawson‚Äôs ability to secure future equipment or hosting partnerships? Ongoing legal disputes and leadership changes can raise counterparty risk concerns. Equipment manufacturers and hosting partners may renegotiate terms or delay new agreements pending resolution. Could regulatory agencies get involved? While the current proceedings are civil, if fraud is substantiated, state or federal regulators may initiate separate enforcement action depending on the facts. The post Bitcoin Miner Mawson Fires CEO, Files Fraud Lawsuit ‚Äì What‚Äôs Going On? appeared first on Cryptonews .

headline: Coinbase, the largest cryptocurrency exchange in the US, has launched new futures products for US users! Here are the details.
summary: Coinbase, the largest cryptocurrency exchange in the United States, has announced the launch of perpetual futures products for US users. The move comes amid growing clarity regarding crypto regulations in the country. Coinbase Launches CFTC-Regulated Perpetual Futures Trading for US Investors Coinbase announced on Monday that two futures contracts, nano Bitcoin Perpetual Futures (BTI) and nano Ethereum Perpetual Futures (ETI), have begun trading. The company stated: For years, US crypto investors have been content to look at this popular product, which benefits international users, from afar. These transactions were inaccessible in the US due to complex regulatory frameworks. That's now changing. The new perpetual products offer leverage up to 10x and, unlike traditional futures, can be extended to five-year maturities. Coinbase stated that this flexibility will allow users to implement long-term strategies. Trading fees start at 0.02% per contract. This launch comes at a time of critical developments regarding crypto regulations in the US. The recently passed GENIUS Act provides a clear legal framework for stablecoins, while the Clarity Act aims to provide a comprehensive roadmap for the overall crypto market by clarifying the mandates of regulatory bodies like the SEC and CFTC. These developments have led to significant price increases in many major crypto assets, particularly Bitcoin and Ethereum. Coinbase shares also reached an all-time high of $437 last Friday, surpassing a market capitalization of $100 billion. However, as of Monday, Coinbase shares closed down 1.47% at $413.63. *This is not investment advice. Continue Reading: Coinbase, the largest cryptocurrency exchange in the US, has launched new futures products for US users! Here are the details.

headline: Bitcoin Whale Transfer: Unveiling the Mysterious $496 Million Kraken Move
summary: BitcoinWorld Bitcoin Whale Transfer: Unveiling the Mysterious $496 Million Kraken Move The cryptocurrency world is no stranger to monumental shifts, but every so often, a transaction occurs that sends ripples across the entire digital ocean. Recently, the crypto community was abuzz with news of a significant Bitcoin whale transfer , specifically, 4,166 BTC moving from the popular exchange Kraken to an undisclosed wallet. This single transaction, valued at approximately $496 million at the time, wasn‚Äôt just a number; it was a powerful signal, sparking intense speculation and prompting a closer look at the mysterious movements of the crypto market‚Äôs biggest players. What Exactly Happened: Unpacking the Mammoth Bitcoin Whale Transfer? The alert came from Whale Alert, a well-known blockchain tracker that monitors large cryptocurrency transactions. Their report highlighted the movement of 4,166 Bitcoins, a sum that instantly grabs attention due to its sheer size. The source was identified as Kraken, one of the oldest and most reputable cryptocurrency exchanges, and the destination was simply labeled an ‚Äúunknown wallet.‚Äù This anonymity is typical in the decentralized world of crypto but adds a layer of intrigue to such a substantial movement. For context, nearly half a billion dollars changing hands in a single transaction is a rare occurrence in any financial market, let alone one as volatile and nascent as cryptocurrency. This particular Bitcoin whale transfer wasn‚Äôt just large; it was a statement, a ripple that could potentially foreshadow larger market trends or strategic plays by influential entities. Who Are These Crypto Whales, and Why Do Their Moves Matter? In the vast ocean of cryptocurrency, ‚Äúwhales‚Äù are individuals or entities holding enormous amounts of a particular digital asset, significant enough to influence market prices. Think of them as the institutional investors or major players in traditional finance. Their actions, whether buying, selling, or simply moving large sums, can create significant waves. When a Bitcoin whale transfer of this magnitude occurs, it‚Äôs akin to a major institutional investor in traditional stocks making a massive block trade. It raises questions: Are they preparing to sell, potentially driving prices down? Are they moving funds to cold storage for long-term holding, indicating confidence? Is it an internal transfer, perhaps for security reasons or rebalancing portfolios? Understanding the motivations behind these transfers is key to deciphering their potential impact. While not every large transfer signals an imminent market shift, the collective behavior of whales often provides insights into market sentiment and potential future directions. Why Do Whales Move Such Enormous Sums? Exploring the Motivations Behind a Bitcoin Whale Transfer The mystery of an ‚Äúunknown wallet‚Äù often fuels speculation, but there are several common reasons why a whale might execute such a substantial Bitcoin whale transfer : Reason for Transfer Explanation & Potential Impact Cold Storage & Security Many whales move funds from exchanges to secure hardware wallets (cold storage) to mitigate risks of exchange hacks or regulatory changes. This is often a sign of long-term holding and a bullish sentiment, as it takes coins off the active trading market. Over-the-Counter (OTC) Deals Large transactions are often executed via OTC desks to avoid impacting exchange order books and causing price volatility. The BTC might be moving to an escrow or directly to a buyer‚Äôs wallet as part of a private sale. This is generally neutral to bullish as it signifies demand. Exchange Rebalancing Exchanges themselves often move funds between their hot and cold wallets, or between different internal addresses, for operational efficiency, security, or to manage liquidity. Such transfers are internal and usually have no market impact. Preparation for Sale/Distribution While less common for transfers off an exchange to an unknown wallet (usually they move to an exchange for selling), a whale might move funds to a different wallet to prepare for a distribution to multiple addresses or to an institution. This could signal an impending sale, but not always directly. Market Manipulation In some cases, large transfers can be part of a broader strategy to influence market sentiment, though this is harder to prove. Moving funds might be a tactic to create FUD (Fear, Uncertainty, Doubt) or FOMO (Fear of Missing Out). Without specific information about the wallet‚Äôs owner or purpose, it‚Äôs challenging to pinpoint the exact reason for this particular Bitcoin whale transfer . However, understanding these common scenarios helps put the transaction into perspective. What‚Äôs the Ripple Effect? Analyzing the Market Impact of a Massive Bitcoin Whale Transfer A transaction of this size inevitably raises questions about its potential impact on the broader crypto market. While a single Bitcoin whale transfer doesn‚Äôt always dictate market direction, it can certainly influence sentiment and volatility, especially when coupled with other market factors. Potential Market Dynamics: Increased Volatility: The sheer volume of BTC moved can create a perception of impending market action, leading to increased trading activity and price fluctuations as traders react to the news. Investor Sentiment Shift: If the market perceives the transfer as a precursor to a large sell-off, it can trigger fear and potentially lead to price drops. Conversely, if it‚Äôs seen as a move to cold storage, it might instill confidence. Liquidity Implications: If the BTC is moved off an exchange, it effectively reduces the immediate supply available for trading on that platform, which could theoretically impact liquidity. Media and Social Media Buzz: Large whale movements often become hot topics on crypto news outlets and social media, amplifying their perceived significance and potentially leading to self-fulfilling prophecies in market movements. It‚Äôs crucial for investors to remember that correlation does not equal causation. A large transfer might coincide with a price movement, but it might not be the direct cause. Many factors contribute to crypto price action, including macroeconomic trends, regulatory news, technological developments, and overall market sentiment. Can We Track These Whales? The Role of On-Chain Analytics and Kraken‚Äôs Position One of the beauties of blockchain technology is its transparency. While the identity behind an ‚Äúunknown wallet‚Äù remains private, the transactions themselves are publicly recorded on the blockchain. This allows services like Whale Alert and other on-chain analytics platforms to track large movements, providing valuable data for market analysis. On-Chain Analytics: These tools provide insights into wallet balances, transaction volumes, and flow of funds between different entities (exchanges, smart contracts, individual wallets). By analyzing these patterns, researchers can often infer the likely purpose of a Bitcoin whale transfer , even if the owner remains anonymous. For instance, if funds move from an exchange to a wallet that has been dormant for years, it strongly suggests cold storage. If they move to another exchange, it might signal an intent to trade. Kraken‚Äôs Role: As one of the oldest and most trusted cryptocurrency exchanges, Kraken plays a significant role in the crypto ecosystem. While the transfer originated from Kraken, it does not imply any wrongdoing on the exchange‚Äôs part. Exchanges facilitate transactions for their users. They maintain robust security measures and adhere to regulatory compliance, but they cannot control what users do with their assets once they withdraw them to external wallets. This specific Bitcoin whale transfer highlights the decentralized nature of crypto, where users ultimately control their assets once off an exchange, and the destination can be truly ‚Äúunknown‚Äù in terms of ownership. Beyond the Headlines: Security Implications and Actionable Insights for Investors While a massive Bitcoin whale transfer like this is intriguing, it also subtly reminds us of broader themes in cryptocurrency: security and prudent investing. Security First: Exchange Security: Reputable exchanges like Kraken employ advanced security protocols. However, no system is entirely immune to threats. This reinforces the importance of using strong, unique passwords, enabling two-factor authentication (2FA), and being wary of phishing attempts. Self-Custody: The transfer to an ‚Äúunknown wallet‚Äù often means the owner has taken self-custody of their assets. This offers greater control and reduces counterparty risk but places the full responsibility of security (seed phrases, hardware wallet protection) on the individual. Actionable Insights for the Savvy Investor: For everyday crypto enthusiasts and investors, a large Bitcoin whale transfer should not be a cause for panic, but rather an opportunity for informed reflection: Don‚Äôt React Impulsively: Avoid making hasty trading decisions based solely on a single whale alert. Large transfers are complex and often have multiple interpretations. Conduct Your Own Research (DYOR): Dig deeper. Look at broader market trends, technical analysis, and fundamental news. Don‚Äôt rely solely on sensational headlines. Understand Context: Consider the potential reasons for the transfer (cold storage, OTC, internal rebalancing) before drawing conclusions about its market impact. Manage Risk: Always invest only what you can afford to lose. Diversify your portfolio and have a clear investment strategy, rather not being swayed by every large transaction. Utilize On-Chain Data (Wisely): While on-chain analytics can be powerful, they require expertise to interpret correctly. Use them as one tool among many, not as a sole predictor of market movements. A Concluding Thought: The Enduring Mystery of the Bitcoin Whale Transfer The recent Bitcoin whale transfer from Kraken, valued at nearly half a billion dollars, serves as a powerful reminder of the dynamic and often enigmatic nature of the cryptocurrency markets. While the immediate impact on Bitcoin‚Äôs price may not be directly traceable to this single event, it underscores the significant influence that large holders, or ‚Äúwhales,‚Äù can exert. It also highlights the inherent transparency of blockchain technology, which allows for such movements to be publicly tracked, even if the identities behind them remain veiled. Ultimately, such events are not just news; they are educational moments. They teach us about market mechanics, the importance of security, and the necessity of a calm, research-driven approach to investing in the volatile world of digital assets. As the crypto landscape continues to evolve, keeping an eye on these colossal movements, while understanding their various implications, will remain a key part of navigating this exciting frontier. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) Here are some common questions regarding large Bitcoin transfers and their implications: Q1: What is a Bitcoin whale? A Bitcoin whale is an individual or entity that holds a very large amount of Bitcoin, typically enough to influence market prices with their transactions. There‚Äôs no official threshold, but it generally refers to holdings of hundreds or thousands of BTC. Q2: Does every large Bitcoin transfer cause a price crash? No, not every large Bitcoin whale transfer leads to a price crash. Many transfers are for legitimate reasons like moving funds to cold storage for security, executing over-the-counter (OTC) deals, or internal exchange rebalancing. The market reaction depends on the perceived intent behind the transfer. Q3: How can I track Bitcoin whale movements? You can track large Bitcoin movements using blockchain explorers and dedicated on-chain analytics platforms like Whale Alert, Glassnode, or CryptoQuant. These tools provide real-time data on significant transactions and wallet activities. Q4: Why are some wallets labeled ‚Äúunknown‚Äù? Wallets are labeled ‚Äúunknown‚Äù because the blockchain itself only records addresses, not the real-world identities of their owners. While some addresses can be linked to exchanges or known entities over time, many remain anonymous, especially if they are personal wallets. Q5: Should I be worried if a large amount of Bitcoin leaves an exchange? Not necessarily. While a large outflow from an exchange could signal an intent to sell via OTC or a private deal, it‚Äôs also very common for investors to move their assets off exchanges to personal cold storage for enhanced security. This often indicates a long-term holding strategy, which can be bullish for the asset. Share Your Insights! Did this deep dive into the recent Bitcoin whale transfer spark your curiosity or offer new perspectives? We encourage you to share this article with your friends, fellow investors, and anyone interested in understanding the fascinating dynamics of the crypto market. Your shares help us continue to provide valuable insights and analysis. To learn more about the latest Bitcoin trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin price action. This post Bitcoin Whale Transfer: Unveiling the Mysterious $496 Million Kraken Move first appeared on BitcoinWorld and is written by Editorial Team

headline: Donald Trump Raises Tensions Again: Says Powell Will Be Leaving Soon ‚Äì Here Are the Details of His Critical Statements
summary: US President Donald Trump harshly criticized the high interest rates and said that Fed Chairman Jerome Powell will soon leave his post. The White House reportedly plans to visit the Fed headquarters on Thursday local time. Trump stated that current interest rates are putting homebuyers in a difficult situation, saying, ‚ÄúPowell is keeping interest rates too high, and this is negatively impacting the housing market.‚Äù Stating that the economy is strong, Trump said, ‚ÄúInterest rates should remain at 1% or even be lowered by 3 percentage points or more.‚Äù Trump also announced that eliminating the capital gains tax on home sales is being considered. The president's comments are being interpreted as part of his ongoing criticism of Powell. Trump has repeatedly pressured Powell to cut interest rates and threatened to fire her throughout the year. Related News: Interesting Predictions About Bitcoin (BTC) From an Experienced Analyst: ‚ÄúWithin 20 Years, BTC...‚Äù U.S. Treasury Secretary Benson also argued that the Fed should cut interest rates, saying, ‚ÄúNow is the time to cut rates.‚Äù Meanwhile, Deputy Treasury Secretary Bessant argued that the Fed's ‚Äúmission expansion‚Äù was causing high government spending. The Trump administration has been making frequent allegations lately that the Fed spent $2.5 billion on its office building and that these cost overruns could be grounds for Powell's dismissal. In another noteworthy statement, Trump accused former president Barack Obama of ‚Äúattempting a coup.‚Äù This statement is likely to further escalate political tensions. *This is not investment advice. headline: ATOM Slips 5% as Bitcoin Regains Dominance After Altcoin Season
summary: ATOM, the native token of the Cosmos network, tumbled 5% in the past 24 hours as Bitcoin regained momentum, pulling market attention back to large-cap assets. The move comes after last week‚Äôs ‚Äúaltcoin season,‚Äù where ATOM and other mid-cap tokens outperformed BTC in a broad rally. ATOM fell from $5.26 to $4.98 between July 21 at 11:00 and July 22 at 10:00 UTC, facing heavy resistance at $5.32 during the 15:00 trading hour. Trading volumes spiked to 1.79 million units by 16:00 as sellers overwhelmed buy orders, leading to a clear technical breakdown. The token briefly stabilized near $4.97 overnight, where renewed buying interest pushed ATOM into a narrow $4.95‚Äì$5.05 consolidation range. A modest bounce saw prices recover 0.4% from $4.97 to $4.99 in the hour ending 10:06 UTC, though traders remain cautious about follow-through momentum. This week‚Äôs price action underscores a shift in market focus back to Bitcoin, which is clawing back gains after altcoins dominated headlines last week. Key Technical Indicators Price Action: ATOM fell 5% from $5.26 to $4.98 in 23 hours. Resistance Zone: Heavy selling at $5.25‚Äì$5.32 capped upside moves. Support Zone: Stabilized briefly at $4.93‚Äì$4.97 before small rebound. Volume Spikes: 1.79M units traded during 16:00 selloff; 1.55M units on support test at $4.97. Consolidation Range: Prices hovering in a tight $4.95‚Äì$5.05 band. Recovery Signs: Higher low formation from $4.93 to $4.98 suggests possible accumulation. headline: JPMorgan Eyes Crypto-Backed Loans Amid Shifting Regulatory Winds
summary: JPMorgan Chase is preparing to introduce crypto-backed loans in 2025, allowing clients to use Bitcoin and Ethereum as collateral, a move that signals the bank‚Äôs cautious but strategic expansion into digital assets. JPMorgan Prepares Entry into Crypto Lending Banking giant JPMorgan Chase is reportedly considering launching a crypto-backed lending service as early as 2025, allowing clients to leverage their holdings of Bitcoin and Ethereum. The move reflects the bank‚Äôs growing interest in the evolving digital asset landscape, aligning it with other major U.S. financial institutions that are actively expanding their crypto services. The initiative would allow clients to secure loans without liquidating their cryptocurrency assets, offering a capital-efficient solution particularly attractive to institutional investors. This approach comes amid rising demand for liquidity strategies that preserve digital asset exposure. Regulatory Shifts Fuel Bank Strategy The bank‚Äôs decision appears closely tied to a more receptive regulatory environment in Washington. As lawmakers explore frameworks to govern stablecoins and other digital assets, large institutions like JPMorgan are cautiously positioning themselves for a more integrated role in crypto finance. Rival firms such as Bank of America and Citibank are already advancing their own crypto initiatives, particularly in stablecoin development. JPMorgan‚Äôs foray into crypto collateral lending indicates a desire to stay competitive while navigating the complex regulatory terrain. Dimon‚Äôs Measured Approach to Digital Assets Despite this step forward, JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon continues to express reservations about cryptocurrencies. While the bank is moving toward offering crypto-backed loans, Dimon has remained firm in his stance against providing custody services for digital assets. Emphasizing the bank‚Äôs limits regarding direct involvement in crypto infrastructure, Dimon recently said, ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre going to allow you to buy it, we‚Äôre not going to custody it.‚Äù Dimon has previously voiced concerns over Bitcoin‚Äôs association with leverage and illicit use, signaling that any future expansion would remain tightly controlled. A Strategic Entry, Not a Full Commitment JPMorgan‚Äôs planned lending service reflects a selective, risk-mitigated embrace of the crypto sector. By offering loans without custody, the bank is carefully testing demand while avoiding the legal and operational complexities associated with storing digital assets on behalf of clients. The strategy may set a precedent for other traditional institutions weighing crypto engagement. JPMorgan‚Äôs regulatory compliance track record and substantial asset base could help normalize crypto lending in conventional finance, especially for risk-conscious institutional investors. As clarity around regulation improves and demand for capital-efficient tools grows, crypto-backed lending may become a standard offering among large banks. Disclaimer: This article is provided for informational purposes only. It is not offered or intended to be used as legal, tax, investment, financial, or other advice

headline: South Korea to accelerate crypto legislation after US GENIUS Act clears path
summary: South Korea is fast-tracking cryptocurrency regulations in response to the recently passed GENIUS Act in the United States , signalling a renewed push to tighten oversight of digital assets like Bitcoin and Ethereum. The country‚Äôs ruling party announced plans to speed up crypto-focused legislation, aiming to create a clearer legal framework for virtual assets, exchanges, and stablecoins. Officials say the move is necessary to stay competitive in the global digital finance space and to improve investor safety. The GENIUS Act, passed in the US earlier this month, is seen by South Korean policymakers as a turning point in global crypto regulation. In response, South Korea is advancing its own proposals, including new tax laws, clearer custody rules for crypto exchanges, and support for won-based stablecoins. This marks one of the country‚Äôs most ambitious efforts to date to adapt its financial laws to the rapidly evolving crypto ecosystem. Bitcoin Archive @BTC_Archive ¬∑ Follow JUST IN: South Korea‚Äôs ruling party to accelerate Bitcoin and crypto legislation following the Genius Act üá∞üá∑ 6:11 PM ¬∑ Jul 22, 2025 1.2K Reply Copy link Read 87 replies Focus areas include crypto taxes, exchange compliance, and stablecoin rules According to recent announcements from South Korea‚Äôs Democratic Party, the government is focusing on three core areas: tightening tax policies for digital asset transactions, clarifying how exchanges manage user funds, and setting up legal structures to prevent crypto-related fraud. These steps are designed to increase transparency while also building a safe environment for both retail and institutional investors. Regulators are reportedly working on policies to better define the responsibilities of crypto exchanges, particularly regarding the segregation of user and platform assets. The revised rules would also introduce licensing conditions and regular audits, aligning with international standards seen in jurisdictions such as Singapore and the US. The GENIUS Act, passed in the US Congress earlier this month, is being cited as a trigger for South Korea‚Äôs shift. Local lawmakers view it as a sign that other major economies are moving swiftly to regulate the digital asset space. They now see regulatory delays as a risk to both economic competitiveness and investor confidence. Korea Investment and Securities develops won-backed stablecoin Alongside regulatory updates, South Korea is also investing in homegrown blockchain-based payment infrastructure. Korea Investment and Securities, one of the country‚Äôs largest financial services firms, is currently developing a stablecoin backed by the Korean won. The digital currency is intended to facilitate real-time payments and financial transactions across consumer and business platforms. It will also offer more stable alternatives to volatile cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin and Ethereum in day-to-day use. This effort mirrors similar moves in other economies, including Japan‚Äôs regulated yen-backed stablecoin initiatives and the European Union‚Äôs exploration of a digital euro. By supporting a won-linked stablecoin, South Korea aims to provide a compliant digital currency that is fully integrated into the national financial system. Crypto ownership climbs, especially among younger investors The push to update regulations comes amid a growing wave of public interest in crypto assets across South Korea. More than 25% of South Koreans aged 20 to 50 now hold some form of cryptocurrency, according to recent data. Among them, nearly 70% are planning to increase their holdings. Analysts believe this demographic shift is part of a larger global trend, where digital assets are being viewed not just as speculative tools, but as part of long-term investment and retirement strategies. The increased participation also underlines the urgency for effective legal frameworks that can address fraud prevention, asset protection, and fair taxation. By fast-tracking its own regulations, South Korea aims to position itself at the forefront of digital finance in the region, particularly as stablecoin projects and decentralised finance (DeFi) applications grow in prominence. The post South Korea to accelerate crypto legislation after US GENIUS Act clears path appeared first on Invezz

headline: Dogecoin Price Prediction: DOGE Clears Key Resistance ‚Äì $10 Next Target?
summary: The Dogecoin price has fallen by 2% in the past 24 hours, with the meme token dropping to $0.2667 on a day of correction for major tokens. And what‚Äôs particularly bullish for Dogecoin is that it has very recently cleared a key resistance level on its one-week chart, indicating that it has now entered a growth phase. Given its ongoing popularity as a meme token, and given the overall trajectory of the market right now, this points to a strong Dogecoin price prediction for the rest of the year, and beyond. This is a strong indication of a breakout, although some perspective is in order, since we have seem similar patterns in the past, without a new top emerging. For instance, its big rally in 2021 saw a peak in the MACD just before July, but subsequent bounces (after July) failed to restore the coin to the ATH it achieved in May. It‚Äôs therefore arguable that something similar could happen this time around, and that despite clearing a resistance level, the Dogecoin price may not return to the $0.466 level it posted in early December. headline: Coinbase Rolls Out Perpetual Futures for U.S. Traders Amid Regulatory Breakthrough
summary: Coinbase, the largest U.S.-based crypto exchange, has introduced a new product called perpetual futures for American traders. This move marks a significant milestone for the U.S. cryptocurrency market. For years, it has lagged behind global markets in offering advanced trading tools because of regulatory restrictions. With more explicit rules now emerging in the country, the soon-to-be-trillion-dollar company is opening the door to new possibilities. Coinbase Perpetual Futures Now Available in the U.S. For the first time, the U.S.-based crypto traders can now access perpetual futures contracts through Coinbase. On July 21, the exchange rolled out two new products: nano Bitcoin Perpetual Futures and nano Ethereum Perpetual Futures. These contracts are designed to enable traders to place long-term bets on cryptocurrency prices without the fixed end dates typically associated with traditional futures. Furthermore, the new contracts include several key features. Coinbase is now allowing users to trade these contracts with up to 10x leverage. This means traders can increase their exposure without having to put down the full value of the contract. Unlike traditional futures that expire monthly or quarterly, these products are set to expire in five years. This is poised to give users more time to hold their positions. Additionally, trading fees start as low as 0.02% per contract, making it an accessible option for both experienced and novice traders. Coinbase states that its goal is to help traders develop more flexible and long-term strategies. The contracts are ‚Äúnano‚Äù in size, meaning they allow smaller position sizes, which can be less risky and more manageable for individual users. Backed by Regulatory Progress The timing of this launch aligns with significant developments in U.S. crypto regulation. Two newly passed legislative measures have brought clarity and optimism to the market. Recently, President Donald Trump signed the GENIUS Act into law , which creates clear rules for stablecoins. Also, the U.S. House of Representatives has passed the Clarity Act. This proposed bill aims to define the regulation of digital assets in the U.S. It outlines the roles of both the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) and the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC). These laws aim to reduce uncertainty and make it easier for platforms like Coinbase to introduce new products while staying compliant with federal law. Market Reaction and Coinbase Stock Surge The news has had a significant impact on the cryptocurrency market. Following the announcement and recent legislation, the prices of Bitcoin (BTC), Ethereum (ETH), and several other major cryptocurrencies experienced sharp increases. This indicates that investor confidence is on the rise again. Coinbase also saw a strong response in the stock market. The company‚Äôs shares reached a new all-time high above $437 last Friday, shortly after hitting a $100 billion market capitalization earlier in the week. On Monday, Coinbase shares dipped slightly, falling 1.47% to $413.63, according to Google Finance. The post Coinbase Rolls Out Perpetual Futures for U.S. Traders Amid Regulatory Breakthrough appeared first on TheCoinrise.com .

headline: Bitcoin Promoter Strategy (STR) Market Cap Is Being Miscalculated, According to TD Cowen Analysts! Here's Why
summary: TD Cowen countered criticism that Strategy‚Äôs (STR) market capitalization should be indexed solely to Bitcoin assets, stating that this approach is logically flawed. TD Cowen: Strategy's Premium Value Justified by Bitcoin Capital Cycle Analysts argue that the company's aggressive share issuance increases investors' stake in the stock rather than diluting it. Strategy's market capitalization currently stands at $124.3 billion, with a total Bitcoin holding of approximately $72 billion. This puts the company's trading premium over its net asset value (NAV) at 72.6%. TD Cowen analysts Lance Vitanza and Jonnathan Navarrete say this premium cannot be explained by the ‚Äúbig fool theory.‚Äù ‚ÄúCritics argue that Strategy's valuation is based solely on another investor in the market buying at a higher price. But this is an incomplete perspective that ignores both its business model and its capital deployment strategy,‚Äù they said. According to TD Cowen, the Strategy increases the amount of Bitcoin per share by channeling low-cost capital into Bitcoin. This strategy provides an advantage that neither individual investors nor competing institutional firms can easily replicate. It emphasizes that the company is able to raise capital through low-interest borrowing at 0.421%, which directly translates into Bitcoin returns. 900,000 BTC Target in 2027 Last week, Strategy raised $739.8 million through the sale of 1.6 million new shares and three preferred stock issuances as part of its $21 billion at-the-market program. With this capital, it purchased 6,220 Bitcoins at an average price of $118,940. According to TD Cowen, this transaction increased the company's BTC per share by 20.8% compared to January 1st. While maintaining its $680 target price for Strategy shares, TD Cowen predicts the company could reach 900,000 BTC by the end of 2027. This amount equates to 4.3% of the all-time Bitcoin supply. The company also opened a new funding stream on Monday with the launch of a fourth series of perpetual preferred stock called Stretch (STRC). With reserves of 607,770 BTC as of July 21, Strategy is currently the world's largest publicly traded Bitcoin holder. *This is not investment advice. headline: Solana DeFi Rebirth: TVL Breaks Past $14 Billion Amid Price Surge
summary: Solana‚Äôs price rally reached a new milestone on Monday. SOL traded at $195.50 per coin, pushing the total valuation to over $105 billion for the first time since January‚ÄØ25. Related Reading: Too Pricey? Expert Says XRP Beats Bitcoin And Ethereum Right Now That jump reflects growing optimism around the token. Short‚Äëterm gains have been strong, but questions remain about how deep the recovery really runs. DeFi TVL Rises With Price Based on reports, Solana‚Äôs total value locked in DeFi hit $14.18 billion. That‚Äôs the highest level in six months, back to where it stood in January when SOL first reached its all‚Äëtime high. A big chunk of that gain comes from the token‚Äôs own price climbing. When SOL moves up, every coin locked in lending pools and vaults gets worth more on paper. Users haven‚Äôt needed to rush in and lock fresh tokens to boost TVL numbers. The overall ecosystem feels larger. Yet true usage growth may be slower than those headline figures suggest. Experts are keeping a close eye on how many new deposits actually show up. After all, token value and real‚Äëworld demand don‚Äôt always rise at the same pace. DEX Trading Activity Shows Uptick Between July‚ÄØ14 and July‚ÄØ20, Solana‚Äôs decentralized exchanges handled over $22 billion in trading volume. That‚Äôs up from close to $19 billion the week before. Raydium led with $8.4 billion, followed by Orca at almost $6 billion and Meteora at $5.3 billion. Based on data, traders are coming back. But weekly volumes still sit far below the $98 billion peak set in mid‚ÄëJanuary. That gap signals a market that‚Äôs warming up but not yet boiling over. Volume gains show renewed interest among active users. It also hints that fresh strategies and new tokens may be finding feet after a slower spell. Staking Dominates Network Security According to on‚Äëchain figures, about 355‚ÄØmillion SOL remain staked with validators. That stake is worth roughly $69 billion, or about 65% of all tokens in circulation. Those coins aren‚Äôt counted in DeFi TVL or in DEX volumes. Instead, they‚Äôre busy securing the network and validating transactions. Related Reading: XRP Over Everything? Expert Tells New Investors To Go All In Meanwhile, SOL is predicted to increase another 3.50% and hit $210 by August‚ÄØ21, 2025. Sentiment is currently bullish while the Fear & Greed Index is at 71 (Greed). In the past 30 days, SOL experienced 19/30 green days and 8.61% price fluctuations, indicating both strength and volatility in today‚Äôs market, data from CoinCodex shows. Featured image from Meta, chart from TradingView

headline: Cardano Clash: Hoskinson Defends IOG Amid Whale Backlash
summary: Charles‚ÄØHoskinson devoted a 14‚Äëminute livestream on Monday to a pointed rebuttal of a prominent Cardano ‚Äúwhale‚Äù and decentralized‚Äërepresentative who has pledged to cast blanket ‚Äúno‚Äù votes on every future funding request from Input‚ÄØOutput‚ÄØGlobal (IOG). The unnamed whale, posting under the alias ‚ÄúGeneric‚ÄØRational,‚Äù claims the project‚Äôs founding engineering company ‚Äúhas not delivered much for years‚Äù and is ‚Äúrequesting obscene amounts of funds to keep the same show of non‚Äëdelivery going.‚Äù Hoskinson Fires Back: ‚ÄòCardano Has Delivered‚Äô Hoskinson called the charge ‚Äúego‚Äëdriven‚Äù and ‚Äúfact‚Äëfree,‚Äù rattling off a catalogue of milestones he says the community now takes for granted: ‚ÄúVoltaire got delivered a year ago; we have Genesis Keys today; we have a constitution; we have a full on‚Äëchain government.‚Äù He cited the maturation of Hydra , the launch of Leios, and Midnight ‚Äôs capacity‚Äëtesting 37‚Äëmillion‚Äëwallet airdrop as evidence that ‚Äúevery single IOG employee delivers something every single day.‚Äù At the centre of the feud is the whale‚Äôs assertion that liquidating $100‚ÄØmillion in ADA to seed a Cardano sovereign‚Äëwealth fund would crater the token‚Äôs market price. Hoskinson countered that daily spot and derivatives turnover has exceeded$2.5‚ÄØbillion and that over‚Äëthe‚Äëcounter desks regularly place ten‚Äëto‚Äëtwenty‚Äëfive‚Äëmillion‚Äëdollar blocks ‚Äúwithout moving the market one bit.‚Äù ‚ÄúIt is factually true,‚Äù he insisted, ‚Äúthat if you divest a hundred million dollars worth of ADA the right way you can do it both quickly and not disrupt the market.‚Äù The confrontation lands just two weeks before Rare‚ÄØEvo, the annual developer‚Äëand‚Äëgovernance summit scheduled for 6‚Äì10‚ÄØAugust in Las‚ÄØVegas where attendees will debate the first long‚Äëterm budget under Cardano‚Äôs new constitutional era and elect a permanent Constitutional Committee. Hoskinson, whose firm currently holds an interim seat, reminded viewers that IOG will relinquish all formal governance authority once the community‚Äëelected committee is seated later this year. ‚ÄúDecentralisation doesn‚Äôt mean there‚Äôs no leadership,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúIt means you can pick them, you can fire them, and you can change direction as a network.‚Äù He urged ADA holders to express disapproval of ‚Äúego and emotion‚Äù by redirecting stake away from disruptive representatives. ‚ÄúGovernance requires consent of the governed,‚Äù he noted, echoing political theory while warning that broad‚Äëbrush obstruction threatens to turn Cardano governance into ‚Äúa Jerry Springer episode.‚Äù Beyond the immediate skirmish, Hoskinson argued that the ecosystem must settle on a forward‚Äëlooking narrative and clear performance metrics. Relying solely on total value locked or transaction counts, he said, leaves Cardano vulnerable to external perceptions that ‚Äúwe‚Äôre not looking so good.‚Äù He floated Bitcoin‚Äënative DeFi and zero‚Äëknowledge privacy sidechain Midnight as contenders for a defining theme over the next five years, but stressed that whichever story emerges, it must come with measurable key performance indicators and disciplined funding. ADA changed hands at roughly $0.89 on 22‚ÄØJuly, up nearly 50% since mid‚ÄëJune lows. Whether that momentum survives an intensifying governance quarrel may depend less on Twitter skirmishes than on the deliberations that begin in Las‚ÄØVegas next month‚Äîand on the willingness of delegators to reward, or punish, the behaviour of their chosen representatives. Hoskinson closed with a familiar rallying cry: ‚ÄúWe are now the most decentralised cryptocurrency on the planet. It‚Äôs up to all of you to keep it that way‚Äîand to demand that it‚Äôs both effective and efficient.‚Äù At press time, ADA traded at $0.8739.
tags: Cardano|ADA|ADA news|ADA Price|Cardano news|Cardano Price|Charles Hoskinson
